p: The novel coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), a viral outbreak caused by the severe acute respiratory syndrome-coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), first arose in Wuhan, China, in December 2019, and it was declared a Public Health Emergency of International Concern on January 30, 2020 ( WHO, 2020b). Seven months into the COVID-19 pandemic, the number of cumulative cases continues to steadily increase. As of August 3, 2020, 17,660,523 cases had been detected, with 680,894 total deaths globally. Africa has borne 4.5% of global morbidity and 2.0% of fatalities ( WHO, 2020a).
